ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a great deal about building a successfully intriguing and fictionalized narrative--how to engage with the reader, and how to present the inner-workings of a mind telling a story. Most important, I grew by leaps and bounds as a writer of fiction, growing more and more comfortable with my voice and style.
An amazing experience. So glad I got the chance to work with John Crowley and write speculative fiction stories. I learned so much about writing and non-realistic stories. Crowley gave good feedback!

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: It would have been nice if Crowley was on campus more days of the week, but we made it work and I'm so grateful that he took me on as an independent study student! This program is extremely important and I was glad I had the opportunity to do so.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Chance to create your own curriculum and write. I wrote speculative fiction with John Crowley and it was a blast! Find an instructor and do it!!!
